bibl.title: Letter from Guillermo Garcia Lopez to Philip Showalter Hench, March 10, 1952

div1.p: Lopez thanks Hench for his contributions to the recent Havana conference. He was pleased to learn about Hench's work with cortisone, and also appreciated Hench's thoughtfulness in presenting slides in both Spanish and English.

div1.head: Letter from Guillermo Garcia Lopez to Philip Showalter Hench, March 10, 1952
div1.opener:
AIR MAIL
DR. GUILLERMO GARCIA LOPEZ
CONSULTAS PREVIA CITA
4 NO. 512 ENTRE 21 Y 23
TELF. F-5143 - VEDADO
HABANA
Havana - CUBA
March 10-1952
Philip S. Hench, M.D.
Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minnesota
U.S.A.
Dear Dr. Hench:
div1.p:
I take pleasure in receiving your kind letter of
February 22. I am very sorry that I was unable to see you again
after the Conference. On Friday, February 1st., I asked for you
at the Hotel Internacional in Varadero and was told that your
telephone did not answer, neither could I get you at the Hotel.

I wish to take this opportunity to express my
appreciation for your brilliant contribution to our Conference
with your most interesting work on treatments of cortone on
rheumatic diseases. Everyone was so pleases with your work,
they all knew of your wide experience and also appreciated your
thoughtfulness in presenting slides both in English and Spanish,
what enabled everybody to understand them.

I trust that this opportunity I had to meet you
through Dr. Tom D. Spies, whom I hold in high esteem ever since
we began working in collaboration at Havana University six years
ago, will allow us to continue a pleasant friendship. I also
hope to be able to return your visit in Rochester sometime.
div1.closer: Yours very truly, Dr. Guillermo García López GGL-ac.
